column1: At thirteen years of age he was at work in New York
column2: and soon was discovered to be the editor in secret of a paper called The Thespian Mirror. The merit of this juvenile sheet attracted the attention of many people
column3: and among them of Mr. Seaman
column4: a wealthy New Yorker who offered the talented boy an opportunity to go to college free of expense. Young Payne gladly accepted the invitation
column6: where he soon became one of the most popular boys in the school. His handsome face
column7: graceful manners and elegant delivery were met with applause whenever he spoke in public
column8: and a natural taste led him to seek every chance for declamation and acting. Even as a child he had showed his dramatic ability
column9: and more than once he was urged to go upon the stage. But his father refused all offers and kept the boy steadily at his work.
